Field Detail

BASE

protected static final int BASE
The parsePath method returns an array of length two. These two values BASE and PROPERTY represent the two indexes into that array. result[BASE] is the base path of the object with the final property, and result[PROPERTY] is the name of the property specified on that object.

See Also:
parsePath(String), Constant Field Values

PROPERTY

protected static final int PROPERTY
The parsePath method returns an array of length two. These two values BASE and PROPERTY represent the two indexes into that array. result[BASE] is the base path of the object with the final property, and result[PROPERTY] is the name of the property specified on that object.

See Also:
parsePath(String), Constant Field Values

ROOT_CRIT

protected static final java.lang.String ROOT_CRIT
Key for root criteria in the critMap that is passed around when building a criteria from a Search. The root criteria is the Criteria object that is actually used in the hibernate query.

See Also:

TO_ARRAY_RESULT_TRANSFORMER

protected static final org.hibernate.transform.ResultTransformer TO_ARRAY_RESULT_TRANSFORMER
This is a ResultTransformer is used for fetchMode == Search.FETCH_ARRAY. It transforms each result into an ordered array.

startCriteria

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.hibernate.Criteria> startCriteria(Search search)
As we build a Criteria we keep track of the tree of Criteria that are needed for all the nested properties (if any). This method initializes the map data structure that is used to hold that tree.

addPaging

protected void addPaging(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.hibernate.Criteria> critMap,
                         Search search)
Apply the paging options (maxResults, page, firstResult) from the search to the Criteria.

addPaging

protected void addPaging(org.hibernate.Criteria crit,
                         Search search)
This method adds the page and max results options to the criteria if specified by the search. It also deals with a tricky issue with database paging when fetching collections eagerly. Eager collection fetching is accomplished by joining the tables and having a row in the result set for each collection item. This messes with the paging options. So this method checks if paging is being used on an entity that has eagerly fetched collection properties. If it does it forces those to load by separate selects in this case.

Parameters:
crit -
search -

initEagerCollections

protected void initEagerCollections()
This method initializes eagerCollections. eagerCollections should contain all collections that are to be loaded eagerly. Before we use it, we need to fill it using this method.

addOrdering

                                                                   Filter filter,

Generate a single Criterion from a single Filter.

getCriteria

protected org.hibernate.Criteria getCriteria(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.hibernate.Criteria> map,
                                             java.lang.String path)

This method is the core of processing nested properties. It takes a path such as "firstKitten" or "parent.firstKitten" and returns the criteria or sub criteria based at that path. Once we have that base criteria we can add any of our specifications to it.

In order to get a sub criteria the method recursively adds criteria starting from the root. Once a sub criteria is created it is stored in the map with a key equal to its path. Subsequent references to the same path will retrieve the criteria from there.

Parameters:
path - This is the path to the base of the criteria. For example if we are adding a filter for the property "city.name", we need to get the criteria based at "city" and add a restriction for "name" to it. So getCriteria(critMap, "city") would be used.

parsePath

protected java.lang.String[] parsePath(java.lang.String path)
This is a helper function used in processing a Search. Parse a nested property path into the base path and property. For example passing in "Cat.firstKitten.name" would return the String array ["Cat.firstKitten", "name"]. Also passing simply "name" would return ["", "name"].

generateAlias

protected java.lang.String generateAlias(java.lang.String path)
We give each nested Criteria an alias. The alias is a function of the path to the criteria so that all aliases are unique.
